Posts.Content: Hi, hope it goes well for you.. I had 5th dose of tax on Tuesday, 20%. Reduction and upped the anti sickness, it has really helped.. 6th and final dose in 2 weeks Be strong.. Thinking of you.. Katharine. X
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Hi Mccaan, I read your thread with interest, I was due to have my 5th tax last week but had to delay as I was still feeling really poorly, I'm now going tomorrow. I am hoping the dose will be reduced but will see. Then my final one in 3 weeks time. I have injections after day 3 for 7 days and also take antibiotics for 7 days during 2nd week. I agree it is awful and you feel really really rough, but speak to your onc, I was told there is no need to suffer. I'm going to ask for stronger anti sickness, which I hope will help. I will be thinking of you and hope if you have it it goes well. Take care and keep in touch. Ill be thinking of you. Katharine. X
Posts.Title: Don't want last taxotere but will I regret it?

Posts.Content: Gaining weight is not going to be good, I am starting Chemo on Tuesday, TAC, i'm not sure what to expect, but in the scheme of things, i suppose its not the worst that can happen. x K.
Posts.Title: Weight?

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny, I havent had an MX but a lumpectomy and Nodes removed under my arms, The stitches sat right on my Bra seam, So, I went into M & S where I was told to look for the ladies with the pink ribbon badge, she told me I was now a pink lady,(as we all are on here) and that any service or help I needed I would get. she was lovely and very helpful. I managed to buy an all cotton bra and after 2 washes is now really soft and comfortable. Before BC I alway shopped at Bravissimo, specialist shops, they also do an all cotton bra that is equally supportavie. I hope this helps a little. Katharine, x
Posts.Title: comfy bra

Posts.Content: Morning, I have just been reading your thread, and had to write to you. I found myself living in 3 week cycles and like looking forward to the 3rd week, building myself up and actually looking forward to the next chemo.. It sounds silly but to miss one would have delayed the hole process.. I did have to delay one but at the time, although disappointing it was necessary... You will get through and I found keeping a diary of how I felt helped. As I knew what to expect the next time. Keep strong. The ladies on here are amazing. There is always someone to help and support you. X Katharine.
Posts.Title: Day 7 Am I a softy?

Posts.Content: Hi, I was told that 2 days after lumpectomy I could remove the plaster and shower, which I did, lovely relief, even if I was a bit concerned. I'm having nodes removed after chemo (1more to go) so not sure about that, hope it's similar to lumpectomy. If your worried speak to nurses on here or phone your macm help line. Hope all is well. Take care. X Katharine.
Posts.Title: Lumpectomy plasters

Posts.Content: Hi I start Chemo next Tuesday, Having pre chemo chat tomorrow, I would love to read your survival guide but can't seem to open it.. It might be me, I'll keep trying. x Thank you. K. x
Posts.Title: Chemotherapy Tips

Posts.Content: Hei oh thank you for that, I will just have to be patient.... I have just had 2nd surgery (last Friday) lymph nodes removed, and hope to start Radiotherapy in the next couple of weeks.. All this and worried about my hair.. Ha ha.. Well done for getting through... All done for the summer.. Thank you for your message.. Big hug. Katharine... X
Posts.Title: Hair Regrowth

Posts.Content: Thank you Maz, It's hearing your incredible courage and getting through that keeps me going.. I agree the chemo was vial (can't spell) and 2 lots surgery, gunk . Etc etc and like you not so worried about radio but hair loss yes that was the worst. But I am getting good at spot the wig. .... I will ditch mine as soon as. .... It's been good but too hot now. X Would love to keep in touch. We're in the world are you.? I am in in Ross on Wye, treatment in Hereford and Cheltenham.. Take care and a big thank you... Katharine. X
Posts.Title: Hair Regrowth

Posts.Content: Hei Help..... I have been reading your messages with interest,, I finished chemo 5 weeks ago, 6 doses of Taxotere. Can I ask anyone, how long does it take for hair to return,, there is nothing!!!
Posts.Title: Hair Regrowth

Posts.Content: Hi TabithaB, Sorry to hear your results, do you know which chemo you will be having. I'm on TAC, and its not pleasnt for the first 10 days but the last week I don't feel too bad and can get out and about. Alot of the ladies on here are on FEC-T, I don't know anything about that so can't help I'm afraid. I hope it goes well for you. I have nr 3 next tuesday assuming my cell count is good enough. fingers crossed. Take care, Katharine.
Posts.Title: results are in :)

Posts.Content: Hi my dear.. My situation is is liar to yours I was also diagnosed week before Christmas, I had my lumpectomy day after Boxing Day. My chemo started 29th Jan 2013. I have just finished 6 sessions of TAC.. All a bit grim, but a week to the day of treatment I felt different. Hang in there and listen to your body... are you having injections, I have one a day for seven days staring 2 days after chemo. I am also going back for full lymph clearance on 14th June, as like you I am holding a slight doubt... Radiotherapy follows after recovery of surgery.. Would love to stay in touch. Thinking of you take care and keep in touch. X By for now Katharine. X
Posts.Title: Feeling anxious

Posts.Content: Sorry should read similar to yours not liar... Oops fluffy brain or what.. Sorry.
Posts.Title: Feeling anxious

Posts.Content: Hi reading your message, I got my wig from a company that comes into the cancer unit once a week or fortnight, I made an appointment and they brought various for me to try, as well as hats and scarves. It maybe worth your while asking at the reception of your bc unit. Mine is acrylic but it is very easy to keep, style and wash. I hung it on the line to dry last week my neighbour thought it was hilarious. Good luck. X Katharine.
Posts.Title: Real hair wig info required

Posts.Content: Hi, I just read your news and had to say well done, I'm having my last chemo next Tuesday, followed my lymph node removal (had lumpectomy before chemo) then rads. But your news was so good I had to say hello and well done you. Have a great weekend. Good luck with rads, will look out for you.. Take care Katharine.
Posts.Title: Today I am a cancer survivor :)
